input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: MUNICIPAL MUNICIPAL PLANT IN PAJĘCZNO. Summary: Successive Delivery of Dolomite Aggregate and Sand for the Needs of the Municipal Plant in Pajęczno in 2026.. Description: 1. The subject of the order is the successive delivery of selected fractions of dolomite aggregate intended for the needs of the Municipal Zakład Komunalny in Pajczno, together with loading, transport and unloading to places indicated by the Ordering Party in the commune. Pajczno. Deliveries of aggregates from metallurgical beehives and their admixtures are not allowed. Part 1: Successive delivery of dolomite aggregate for the needs of the Municipal Zakład Komunalny in Pajczno in 2026. Part 1: Purchase with delivery of: a) dolomite aggregate fraction 4-16 mm in the amount 700 tons, b) dolomite aggregate fraction 0-31.5 mm in an amount of 1,100 tons, c) dolomite aggregate fraction 0-63 mm in an amount of 300 tons. The quantities given in section 2 are indicative and do not constitute an obligation of the Ordering Party. Failure by the Ordering Party to perform the contract in in the remaining scope, it does not require giving reasons and cannot constitute the basis for claims on the part of the Contractor. The order includes transport and unloading of the above-mentioned subject of the order to the place indicated by the Ordering Party in the Pajczno Commune, in quantities and dates depending on the needs of the Ordering Party. The order will be implemented successively according to the needs of the Ordering Party within 48 hours.... Published Date: 2025-12-23. Closing Date: 2025-12-30. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: STATE WATER HOLDING POLISH WATERS. Summary: Dynamic Purchasing System (Dsz) for the Supply of Construction Materials for Organizational Units of the Polish Waters State Water Management Company. Description: 1. The subject of the order is the establishment of a Dynamic Purchasing System (hereinafter referred to as DSZ) for awarding orders for the supply of construction materials to organizational units of the Polish Waters State Water Management. 2. Subject of the order under DSZ has been divided into four categories: Category No. 1 - Delivery of building materials, Category No. 2 - Delivery of electrical goods and lighting, Category No. 3 - Delivery of fittings, plumbing and water and sewage supplies, Category No. 4 - Delivery hand tools and accessories. The Ordering Party allows the possibility of submitting applications to participate in the DSZ for one, several or all Categories. 3. Expected quantities of materials specified in the description of the subject of the order, broken down into individual ones The categories are approximate. The qualification of Contractors to the DSZ in individual Categories does not constitute the basis for claims for deliveries in the quantities indicated in the description of the subject of the order, because at this stage of the validity of the DSZ, none of the the parties do not assume any obligation. Specific quantities of materials in individual Categories will be indicated each time at the stage of initiating procedures for awarding contracts covered by the DSZ. 4. Procedures for awarding implementation orders under The established DSZ in all Categories may be managed by individual Regional Water Management Boards. The delivery locations will be specified in the invitation to submit offers. List of Units.... Published Date: 2025-12-22. Closing Date: 2026-01-26. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: COMMUNE OF ALEKSANDRÓW ŁÓDZKI. Summary: Successive Delivery of Aggregate for the Needs of the Aleksandrów Łódzki Commune. Description: Part I of the order - Delivery of aggregate with granulation of 0-31.5 mm 1. The subject of the order is the successive delivery of aggregates made of natural raw materials such as basalt, granite, gneiss, granodiorite or mixtures of the mentioned minerals with granulation 0-31.5 mm in accordance with standard EN 13242:2002 + A1:2007. 2. It is assumed that the scope of the order will be 8,000 tons of aggregate, subject to point 3. 3. The quantity of aggregate included in the scope of the order is an approximate requirement. In fact, the quantity ordered may change reduction, but not by more than 30% of the estimated order quantity. The Contractor will not be entitled to any claims against the Ordering Party for reducing the quantitative scope of the order during the duration of the contract. 4.The delivered aggregate must be free from defects, meet the parameters and technical and operational requirements specified in the SWZ, have a Declaration of Performance issued by the manufacturer confirming the compliance of the aggregate with applicable standards and physical and chemical properties, meet applicable standards and have the appropriate certificate and do not contain elements harmful to the environment (e.g. asbestos, ashes, etc.) or dangerous for road users (metal, wire, etc.). Part II of the order - Delivery of aggregate with granulation 4 - 31.5 mm 1. The subject of the order is the successive delivery of aggregate made of natural raw materials of the genus basalt, granite, gneiss, granodiorite or mixtures of the mentioned minerals with granulation 4-31.5 mm in accordance with EN 13242:20.... input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: CHOROSZCZ COMMUNE. Summary: Carrying out Equipment and Transport Works as Part of Ongoing Road Maintenance in 2026 in the City and Commune of Choroszcz. Description: 1. The subject of the order is the performance of transport equipment and works as part of the ongoing maintenance of roads in 2026 in the city and commune of Choroszcz. 2. Detailed Description of the Subject of the Order: - work consisting in repairing the surface of municipal roads by incorporation of a mixture of natural aggregate together with incorporation into the road body as a surface layer of unbound aggregate (Contractor's material) along with profiling and compaction in the place of incorporation - the estimated quantity is 21,000 t. Scope of work includes: obtaining the aggregate mixture, loading, transport to the construction site, unloading, spreading the material using a road grader. The ordering party requires that the aggregate be delivered directly from the place of acquisition to the place of construction. The Ordering Party requires that the mixture of natural aggregate intended for the execution of the order meets the requirements specified in Annex No. 3 to Order No. 102 of the General Director of National Roads and Motorways of November 19, 2010. input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: STATE TREASURY PGL STATE FORESTS RYTEL FOREST DISTRICT. Summary: Delivery of Stone Aggregate with Spreading and Rolling on Forest Roads of the Rytel Forest District. Description: 3.1. The subject of the order is the supply of aggregate with spreading and rolling for forest roads of the Rytel Forest District. The delivered aggregate should be used for sectional repairs of forest roads using the following technology: Technology I 1804 tons Stone aggregate of 0 31.5 mm fraction should meet the requirements of the standard PN EN 13242. For each delivered batch of aggregate, the supplier will submit a certificate of conformity or a declaration of compliance with the Polish standard. In the valuation of 1 ton of aggregate, the contractor must include all costs related to the execution of the task, such as: costs of transporting the aggregate, unloading, spreading the aggregate on the roadside asphalt road 2 x 0.75 m x 7 km, spreading aggregate on the road, careful consideration, road profiling, drainage works. The list of road sections may change and the amount of delivered material may be increased aggregates.. Published Date: 2025-12-04. Closing Date: 2025-12-11. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

Description: The order in question involves the implementation of successive deliveries of aggregate (optimal mixture) for the maintenance of forest roads in the Pisz Forest District. The expected total quantity range is 720 m3 (where 1 m3 = 1700 kg) of the optimal mixture 0-31.5 mm (percentage of grains with a surface crushed and broken category not lower than C 50/30) with transport to forest areas located in the Pisz Forest District as indicated by the Ordering Party. The aggregate must meet the requirements of WT-4 2010 for an aggregate mixture for natural aggregate pavements 0/31.5, Fig. 6 in point 2.2.4 in Annex No. 3 to Order No. 102 of the General Director for National Roads and Motorways of November 19, 2010. Mixtures not related to national roads WT-4 2010 Technical Requirements (constituting Annex No. 6 to SWZ) and should have a declaration of compliance with the PN-EN 13242 standard or equivalents, which should be provided to the Ordering Party before supplies.. input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: BECHTEL POLSKA SP. Z O.O.. Summary: Structural Backfill - Supply and Delivery - Poland Ap 1000 Project. Description: The structural backfill is required to adhere to strict quality requirements. The composition of the structural backfill shall be either mixtures of hard, sound, durable silica sand and/or sand-gravel blends, or granitic or basaltic material from either pit-run or quarry (crushed rock) sources which meet the required grain-size distribution. The material shall be medium to well graded per PN-EN ISO 14688-2. The structural backfill shall be devoid of debris, calcareous sands, clay fines, plastic fines, friable particles, or other deleterious materials, and the fines content shall be less than 15 percent. The structural backfill will be devoid of rocks or stones larger than 37.5 millimeters in the greatest dimension. The estimated quantities of structural backfill are subject to change. Project requires each company to have the capacity through company projections of supplying and are delivering at least 1/3 (or 370,000 m3) of the required amount of structural backfill in a year for delivery in either 2028, 2029, or 2030. input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: WIPSOWO FOREST DISTRICT. Summary: Delivery of Aggregate for the Maintenance of Forest Roads Ii. Description: The subject of this order is the supply of aggregate with the installation of forest roads in the surface (hereinafter: Delivery) in the indicated forests located in the Wipsowo Forest District of the following assortments: - mechanical stabilization mixture 0-31.5 mm C50/30 in the amount of 1,409.00 tons. - fattening 22.4-55 mm C50/30 in the amount of 1,409.00 tons, Aggregates covered by the order must meet the standard PN-EN 13242+A1:2010 Aggregates, bound and unbound materials used in buildings and road construction or equivalent. The Scope of Delivery includes: - delivery of aggregates to the place indicated by the Ordering Party, documented each time with a WZ document, - filling of defects, ruts and potholes, clearing and mechanical and manual placing of aggregates or their mixtures on the indicated road section, - compaction of the built-in aggregate with a vibrating road roller or compactor, a detailed description of the subject of the order included is included in Appendix No. 1 to the SWZ.. Published Date: 2025-11-07. Closing Date: 2025-11-14. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed
